tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一して、county を削除しました。

sen.j: 桑田郡（くわたぐん）は、丹波国・京都府にあった郡。
sen.e: Kuwata-gun County existed in Tanba Province and Kyoto Prefecture.
Kuwata-gun County existed in Tanba Province and Kyoto Prefecture.
Kuwata-gun was a county existed in Tanba Province in Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。

sen.j: 丹波国府が置かれていた。
sen.e: The government office of Tanba Province was placed in this county.
The government office of Tanba Province was placed in this county.
The government office of Tanba Province was placed in this county.

sen.j: 山城国との境界に位置し、長岡京・平安京の遷都により都の近郊地帯となる。
sen.e: Located near to the boundary with Yamashiro Province, it became a suburban area of the capitals after the Japanese capital was moved to Nagaokakyo and then to Heiankyo.
Located near to the boundary with Yamashiro Province, it became a suburban area of the capitals after the Japanese capital was moved to Nagaokakyo and then to Heiankyo.
Located near the boundary with Yamashiro Province, it became a suburban area of the capitals after the Japanese capital was moved to Nagaoka-kyo and then to Heian-kyo.

sen.j: 1879年（明治12年）、北桑田郡と南桑田郡に分割された。
sen.e: In 1879, the county was divided into Kita Kuwada-gun County and Minami Kuwada-gun County.
In 1879, the county was divided into Kita Kuwada-gun County and Minami Kuwada-gun County.
In 1879, the county was divided into Kita Kuwada-gun and Minami Kuwada-gun.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一して、county を削除しました。

sen.j: 1645年(正保2年) - 大布施村・八桝村・別所村の3村(現京都市左京区花背)が山城国愛宕郡に編入。
sen.e: 1645: the three villages of Obuse-mura Vllage (大布施村), Yamasu-mura Village (八桝村) and Bessho-mura Village (別所村) (present Hanase, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City) were merged into Otagi-gun county, Yamashiro Province.

1645: the three villages of Obuse-mura Vllage (大布施村), Yamasu-mura Village (八桝村) and Bessho-mura Village (別所村) (present Hanase, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City) were merged into Otagi-gun county, Yamashiro Province.
1645: the three villages of Obuse-mura (大布施村), Yamasu-mura (八桝村) and Bessho-mura (別所村) (present Hanase, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City) were merged into Otagi-gun, Yamashiro Province.

sen.j: 1871年（明治4年）11月22日 - 第1次府県統合により、他の丹波国2郡（船井郡、何鹿郡）とともに久美浜県から京都府の管轄となる。
sen.e: November 22, 1971: Due to the first stage integration of prefecutres, this county was removed from Kumihama Prefecture and was placed under control of Kyoto Prefecture together with two other counties (Funai-gun County and Ikaruga-gun County) of Tanba Province.

November 22, 1971: Due to the first stage integration of prefecutres, this county was removed from Kumihama Prefecture and was placed under control of Kyoto Prefecture together with two other counties (Funai-gun County and Ikaruga-gun County) of Tanba Province.

November 22, 1871: Due to the first stage integration of prefectures, this county was removed from Kumihama Prefecture and was placed under control of Kyoto Prefecture together with two other counties (Funai-gun and Ikaruga-gun) of Tanba Province.
sen.cmt: county を削除しました。スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 1879年（明治12年）3月14日 - 郡区町村編制法により北桑田郡と南桑田郡に分割。
sen.e: March 14, 1879: According to the law for making an organization of counties, wards, towns and villages, the county was divided into Kita Kuwada-gun County and Minami Kuwada-gun County.
March 14, 1879: According to the law for making an organization of counties, wards, towns and villages, the county was divided into Kita Kuwada-gun County and Minami Kuwada-gun County.
March 14, 1879: According to the law for making an organization of counties, wards, towns and villages, the county was divided into Kita Kuwada-gun and Minami Kuwada-gun.

sen.j: 和名抄に見える郡内の郷
sen.e: the villages belonging to the county that aprrear in Wamyosho (an old Japanese dictionary compiled in the Heian period)
Villages belonging to the county that appear in Wamyosho (an old Japanese dictionary compiled in the Heian period)
Villages belonging to the county that appear in Wamyosho (an old Japanese dictionary compiled in the Heian period)

sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。
